benchmark_details.name: Tri-HE
benchmark_details.overview: Tri-HE is a novel Triplet-level Hallucination Evaluation benchmark designed for Large Vision-Language Models to simultaneously measure both object and relation hallucination. It provides a unified framework that evaluates LVLMs by analyzing (object, relation, object) triplets extracted from the models' responses.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and analyze hallucinations in Large Vision-Language Models using a unified triplet-level framework.
audience: Practitioners in AI and machine learning
tasks: Analyzing the prevalence of relation versus object hallucination
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset construction requires significant resources and time for manual verification.

data.annotation: Triplets represent relationships and entities derived from the questions and images

methods: Hallu Q and Hallu I metrics for grading hallucination rates
GPT-4 based judging for hallucination validation
methodology.calculation: Calculating the proportion of hallucinated triplets in the total triplets extracted from LVLM responses.
methodology.interpretation: Lower hallucination rates indicate better alignment between model responses and the actual scene represented in images.
methodology.validation: Validation performed using both human judgments and automated methods via GPT-4

risk_categories: Inspection of ethical implications in model outputs

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset is based on GQA which is publicly available.
